member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.CancelledException
member.summary: This exception will be thrown by the Connect method or any Read or Write method if the operation is cancelled by a call to Disconnect or CancelRequest on another thread.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.CancelledException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CancelledException class.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.CancelledException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CancelledException class with a specified error message.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.CancelledException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CancelledException class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not a null reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.CancelledException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CancelledException class with serialized data.
member.param: The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.ConnectionNotMadeException
member.summary: This exception can be thrown by the Connect method to indicate the the connection could not be established.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.ConnectionNotMadeException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ConnectionNotMadeException class.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.ConnectionNotMadeException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ConnectionNotMadeException class with a specified error message.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.ConnectionNotMadeException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ConnectionNotMadeException class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not a null reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.ConnectionNotMadeException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ConnectionNotMadeException class with serialized data.
member.param: The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.Constants100
member.summary: Miscellaneous constants for use when communicating with the RMC100.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants100.rmc100StsRegsPerAxis
member.summary: (10) Number of registers in each axis's fn100StatusAxisn file. This can be used primarily when computing how many registers to read when you wish to read status registers for multiple axes.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants100.rmc100CmdRegsPerAxis
member.summary: (6) Number of registers in each axis's fn100CommandAxisn file. This can be used primarily when computing how many registers to write when you wish to send commands to multiple axes.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants100.rmc100ParamRegsPerAxis
member.summary: (16) Number of registers in each axis's fn100ParameterAxisn file. This can be used primarily when computing how many registers to read or write when you wish to read or write the parameters of multiple axes.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants100.rmc100RegsPerStep
member.summary: (8) Number of registers per step in the fn100StepTable file. This can be used to calculate the element parameter in read and write methods.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants100.rmc100RegsPerI2EInput
member.summary: (8) Number of registers per input line in the Input-to-Event table in the fn100I2ERisingEdges and fn100I2EFallingEdges files. This can be used to calculate the element parameter in read and write methods.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants100.rmc100RegsPerProfile
member.summary: (4) Number of registers per profile in the fn100ProfileTable file. This can be used to calculate the element parameter in read and write methods.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants100.rmc100RegsPerPlotFile
member.summary: (1024) Number of registers in each plot file fn100PlotAxis0Set0 through fn100PlotAxis7Set5.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants100.rmc100MaxAxes
member.summary: (8) Number of axes on which the RMC100 addressing is based on. This can be used in some calculations of the file or element parameters in read and write methods.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants100.rmc100PlotFilesPerAxis
member.summary: (6) Number of plot files per axis. This can be used to compute the file to use to read up plot data for a particular axis.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants100.rmc100PTPrecision
member.summary: (0) Extra Precision Plot Type. This can be used when reading from or writing to the fn100PlotTypes file.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants100.rmc100PTCommands
member.summary: (1) Command Plot Type. This can be used when reading from or writing to the fn100PlotTypes file.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants100.rmc100PTEvents
member.summary: (2) Event Step Plot Type. This can be used when reading from or writing to the fn100PlotTypes file.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants100.rmc100PTCounts
member.summary: (3) Raw Counts Plot Type. This can be used when reading from or writing to the fn100PlotTypes file.

member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.Constants200
member.summary: Miscellaneous constants for use when communicating with the RMC200.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants200.rmc200CmdRegsPerAxis
member.summary: (10) For calculating the element parameter when writing to the fn200CommandArea file.

member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.Constants150
member.summary: Miscellaneous constants for use when communicating with the RMC150.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants150.rmc150CmdRegsPerAxis
member.summary: (10) For calculating the element parameter when writing to the fn150CommandArea file.

member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.Constants70
member.summary: Miscellaneous constants for use when communicating with the RMC70.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants70.rmc70CmdRegsPerAxis
member.summary: (6) For calculating the element parameter when writing to the fn70CommandArea file.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.Constants70.rmc70LrgCmdRegsPerAxis
member.summary: (10) For calculating the element parameter when writing to the fn70LrgCommandArea file.

member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.DeviceType
member.summary: These constants are used when calling RMCLink.CreateEthernetLink and RMCLink.CreateSerialLink to select which type of controller will be connected to the link.

member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber100
member.summary: File numbers used when communicating with the RMC100.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber100.fn100StepTable
member.summary: (24) Step Table (2048 elements: 256 steps with 8 elements each)

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber100.fn100I2ERisingEdges
member.summary: (25) Input-to-Event Table, Rising Edges (128 elements: 16 inputs with 8 elements (1 per axis) each)

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber100.fn100I2EFallingEdges
member.summary: (26) Input-to-Event Table, Falling Edges (128 elements: 16 inputs with 8 elements (1 per axis) each)

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber100.fn100StatusMap
member.summary: (27) Status Map (Modbus Plus and PROFIBUS only) (32 elements)

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber100.fn100ProfileTable
member.summary: (28) Profile Table (64 elements: 16 profiles with 4 elements each)

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber100.fn100PlotType
member.summary: (29) Plot Type (8 elements: one per axis)

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber100.fn100PlotTime
member.summary: (30) Plot Time (8 elements: one per axis)

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber100.fn100ParamError
member.summary: (31) Last Parameter Error (8 elements: one per axis)

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber100.fn100PlotAxis0Set0

member.summary: (211) Axis 0 Plot, Status Bits Set (1024 elements)

member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber200
member.summary: File numbers used when communicating with the RMC200.

member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber150
member.summary: File numbers used when communicating with the RMC150.

member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber70
member.summary: File numbers used when communicating with the RMC70.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber70.fn70CommandArea
member.summary: (16) Command Registers for all axes (6 regs per axis)

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.FileNumber70.fn70LrgCommandArea
member.summary: (25) Command Registers for all axes (10 regs per axis)

member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.PingType
member.summary: These two constants are used to select whether the RMCLink.IsConnected method will try pinging the device before returning to verify that the link is still connected.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.PingType.DoNotPing
member.summary: RMCLink.IsConnected should return immediately whether the link was connected as of the last communication attempt.

member.name: F:RMCLinkNET.PingType.Ping
member.summary: RMCLink.IsConnected should first do a test communication with the device to make sure that the link is still connected.

member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.ReadWriteFailedException
member.summary: This exception will be thrown by any Read or Write method that has a communication failure while trying to process its request.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.ReadWriteFailedException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ReadWriteFailedException class.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.ReadWriteFailedException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ReadWriteFailedException class with a specified error message.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.ReadWriteFailedException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ReadWriteFailedException class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not a null reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.ReadWriteFailedException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ReadWriteFailedException class with serialized data.
member.param: The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink
member.summary: This class is used to link to RMC controllers to allow reading information from the controller and writing data to the controller.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.CreateEthernetLink(RMCLinkNET.DeviceType,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an RMCLink object for communicating with a controller (RMC70, RMC100, RMC150, or RMC200) over Ethernet.
member.param: Specifies which type of RMC will be linked to. It must be DeviceType.RMC70, DeviceType.RMC100, DeviceType.RMC150, or DeviceType.RMC200.
Specifies the TCP/IP host name for the controller to connect to. This can be an IP address string, such as "192.168.0.10" or a textual host name, such as "rmc.deltamotion.com".
member.returns: Returns a reference to a new RMCLink object created for communicating with the specified device type over TCP/IP using the specified host name.
member.exception: The parameter refers to a null (Nothing in Visual Basic) object.
Either the parameter is not set to DeviceType.RMC70, DeviceType.RMC100, DeviceType.RMC150, DeviceType.RMC200, or the parameter is blank.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.CreateSerialLink(RMCLinkNET.DeviceType,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an RMCLink object for communicating with a controller (either RMC70 or RMC100) over a serial port.
member.param: Specifies which type of RMC will be linked to. It must be either DeviceType.RMC70 or DeviceType.RMC100.
Specifies the serial port to use for communicating with the device. Typical names include "COM1" and "COM2".
member.returns: Returns a reference to a new RMCLink object created for communicating with the specified device type on the specified serial port.
member.exception: The parameter refers to a null (Nothing in Visual Basic) object.
Either the parameter is set to neither DeviceType.RMC70 nor DeviceType.RMC100, or the parameter is blank.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.CreateUSBLink(RMCLinkNET.DeviceType,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an RMCLink object for communicating with a controller (either RMC70, RMC150, or RMC200) over a USB port.
member.param: Specifies which type of RMC will be linked to. It must be either DeviceType.RMC70, DeviceType.RMC150, or DeviceType.RMC200.

Specifies which controller to connect to over the USB port. For RMC200 controllers, the parameter should indicate the controller's 9-digit serial number. For RMC150 controllers, this parameter should indicate the Ethernet (MAC) Address in the format "00-50-A0-xx-yy-zz". For RMC75E controllers, this parameter should indicate the controller's 10-digit serial number in the format "7573xxyyzz".
member.returns: Returns a reference to a new RMCLink object created for communicating over the USB port with a controller with the specified type and device ID.
member.exception: The parameter refers to a null (Nothing in Visual Basic) object.
Either the parameter is set to neither DeviceType.RMC70, DeviceType.RMC150, nor DeviceType.RMC200, or the parameter is blank.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.Connect
member.summary: Establishes a connection with a controller using the settings specified when the RMCLink object was created (device type, port name, host name).
member.exception: This link was already connected. Notice that the link will still be connected after this exception is thrown.
This connection attempt was cancelled by a call on another thread to one of the Disconnect and CancelRequest methods.

The link could not establish a connection. The exception's Message property will give a brief description of why. Check that the remote device is powered up, check the communication wiring, and check the communication configuration of both the local and remote devices.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.Disconnect
member.summary: Closes the connection, if one has been established, associated with this RMCLink object.
member.exception: This link was already disconnected.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.IsConnected(RMCLinkNET.PingType)
member.summary: Checks to see if the link is currently connected to a controller.
member.param: This parameter determines if the link should try sending a test communication with the controller before deciding whether the connection is still established. Specify PingType.Ping to do the test communication, and PingType.DoNotPing to determine if the connection is established based on the last communication attempt. This parameter is ignored if the connection is known to be closed.
member.returns: Returns true if the connection is still established (after a Ping is sent out if ping is set to PingType.Ping). Otherwise, returns false.
member.exception: The parameter is set to neither PinType.Ping nor nor PingType.DoNotPing.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.ReadLFile(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads one or more integer registers (located in an L file) from the controller.
member.param: File number of the registers to be read. See the Address Map for details.
Element number of the first register to be read. See the Address Map for details.
This Int32 array will be filled with the data read from the controller. The length of this array will dictate how many registers are read.
Specifies the starting offset in the array. This is typically zero.
Specifies the number of elements to read into .
member.exception: The parameter refers to a null (Nothing in Visual Basic) object.
One of the and parameters is out of range. Ensure that and are between 0 and 65535.
The array is too long for the requested parameter. Reading beyond element 65535 is not allowed.
The link is not currently connected. The Connect method must be called before attempting to read from or write to the controller.
This read was cancelled by a call on another thread to one of the Disconnect and CancelRequest methods.

The read failed due to a communication failure. Check that the remote device is powered up, check the communication wiring, and check the communication configuration of both the local and remote devices. Check the Message property of the exception for a description of the communication failed.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.ReadFFile(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads one or more floating point registers (located in an F file) from the controller.
member.param: File number of the registers to be read. See the Address Map for details.
Element number of the first register to be read. See the Address Map for details.
This Single array will be filled with the data read from the controller. The length of this array will dictate how many registers are read.
Specifies the starting offset in the array. This is typically zero.
Specifies the number of elements to read into .
member.exception: The parameter refers to a null (Nothing in Visual Basic) object.
One of the and parameters is out of range. Ensure that and are between 0 and 65535.
The array is too long for the requested parameter. Reading beyond element 65535 is not allowed.
The link is not currently connected. The Connect method must be called before attempting to read from or write to the controller.
This read was cancelled by a call on another thread to one of the Disconnect and CancelRequest methods.

The read failed due to a communication failure. Check that the remote device is powered up, check the communication wiring, and check the communication configuration of both the local and remote devices. Check the Message property of the exception for a description of the communication failed.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.ReadBit(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a single bit from an L file register in the controller.
member.param: File number of the register with the bit to be read. See the Address Map for details.
Element number of the register with the bit to be read. See the Address Map for details.
Number of the bit (0-31) to read in the register. Bits are numbered from least to most significant.
member.returns: If the bit that was read was 1, then true is returned, otherwise false is returned.
member.exception: One of the , , and parameters is out of range. Ensure that and are between 0 and 65535, and that is between 0 and 31.
The link is not currently connected. The Connect method must be called before attempting to read from or write to the controller.
This read was cancelled by a call on another thread to one of the Disconnect and CancelRequest methods.

The read failed due to a communication failure. Check that the remote device is powered up, check the communication wiring, and check the communication configuration of both the local and remote devices. Check the Message property of the exception for a description of the communication failed.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.ReadBitField(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a bit field (range of bits) from an L file register in the controller.
member.param: File number of the register with the bit field to be read. See the Address Map for details.
Element number of the register with the bit field to be read. See the Address Map for details.
Bit number (0-31) of the least significant bit in the bit field. Bits are numbered from least to most significant.
Total number of bits in the bit field (1-31).
member.returns: On success, the value of the bit field is returned. On failure an exception is thrown.
member.exception: One of the , , , and is out of range. Ensure that and are between 0 and 65535, is between 0 and 31, and that is between 1 and 32.
A bit field of bits starting at the bit would overrun the 32-bit integer.
The link is not currently connected. The Connect method must be called before attempting to read from or write to the controller.
This read was cancelled by a call on another thread to one of the Disconnect and CancelRequest methods.

The read failed due to a communication failure. Check that the remote device is powered up, check the communication wiring, and check the communication configuration of both the local and remote devices. Check the Message property of the exception for a description of the communication failed.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.WriteLFile(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes to one or more integer registers (located in L files) in the controller linked to by this RMCLink object.
member.param: File number of the registers to be written. See the Address Map for details.
Element number of the first register to be written. See the Address Map for details.
This Int32 array holds the data to write to the specified controller registers.
Specifies the starting offset in the array. This is typically zero.
Specifies the number of elements to write from .
member.exception: The parameter refers to a null (Nothing in Visual Basic) object.
One of the and parameters is out of range. Ensure that and are between 0 and 65535.
Either one or more registers requested to write to were read-only, or the array is too long for the requested parameter. Reading beyond element 65535 is not allowed.
The link is not currently connected. The Connect method must be called before attempting to read from or write to the controller.
This write was cancelled by a call on another thread to one of the Disconnect and CancelRequest methods.

The write failed due to a communication failure. Check that the remote device is powered up, check the communication wiring, and check the communication configuration of both the local and remote devices. Check the Message property of the exception for a description of the communication failed.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.WriteFFile(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes to one or more floating point registers (located in F files) in the controller linked to by this RMCLink object.
member.param: File number of the registers to be written. See the Address Map for details.
Element number of the first register to be written. See the Address Map for details.
This Single array holds the data to write to the specified controller registers.
Specifies the starting offset in the array. This is typically zero.
Specifies the number of elements to write from .
member.exception: The parameter refers to a null (Nothing in Visual Basic) object.
One of the and parameters is out of range. Ensure that and are between 0 and 65535.
Either one or more registers requested to write to were read-only, or the array is too long for the requested parameter. Reading beyond element 65535 is not allowed.
The link is not currently connected. The Connect method must be called before attempting to read from or write to the controller.
This write was cancelled by a call on another thread to one of the Disconnect and CancelRequest methods.

The write failed due to a communication failure. Check that the remote device is powered up, check the communication wiring, and check the communication configuration of both the local and remote devices. Check the Message property of the exception for a description of the communication failed.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.CancelRequest
member.summary: This method can be used in multi-threaded applications to cancel the currently-in-progress read, write, or connect request.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.FRegToLReg(System.Single)
member.summary: Retrieves the value of a LONG register when read by ReadFFile.
member.param: System.Single value returned by ReadFFile to use as a raw 32-bit integer.
member.returns: Returns the 32-bit integer value that was read by ReadFFile.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.LRegToFReg(System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the value that a LONG register should have when written by WriteFFile.
member.param: 32-bit integer value to be sent as is by WriteFFile.
member.returns: Returns a System.Single value to send by WriteFFile.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.ReadImage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the controller image into an integer array. This image can be applied to another controller of the same physical configuration using the WriteImage method. For saving and restoring the controller image using a file, use the ReadImageToFile and WriteImageFromFile methods. This method is only supported on the RMC75E and RMC150E controllers with firmware 3.34.0 or newer.
member.param: Flags used to control how the image is created. Refer to the RMCTools documentation on the Image Area for a current list of options. As of this writing no options have been defined. Specify zero (0) to use default options.
member.returns: The array of Integer elements will contain the controller image read from the controller. The length of this array will vary depending on the actual contents of the controller.
member.exception: The parameter is out of range.
This read was cancelled by a call on another thread to one of the Disconnect and CancelRequest methods.

One of the following circumstances occurred:
The link is not currently connected. The Connect method must be called before attempting to read from the controller.
The Image Area is not supported by this controller. The image area is not supported by the RMC75S and RMC75P, and requires firmware 3.34.0 or newer.

The read failed due to a communication failure. Check that the remote device is powered up, check the communication wiring, and check the communication configuration of both the local and remote devices. Check the Message property of the exception for a description of the communication failure.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.ReadImageToFile(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Reads the controller image and saves it in a file. This file can then be written and applied to another controller of the same physical configuration using the WriteImageFromFile method. For saving and restoring the controller image using an array rather than a file, use the ReadImage and WriteImage methods. This method is only supported on the RMC75E and RMC150E controllers with firmware 3.34.0 or newer.
member.param: Flags used to control how the image is created. Refer to the RMCTools documentation on the Image Area for a current list of options. As of this writing no options have been defined. Specify zero (0) to use default options.
File name and path to save the controller image into.
member.exception: The parameter refers to a null (Nothing in Visual Basic) object.
The parameter is out of range, or the parameter is blank.
This read was cancelled by a call on another thread to one of the Disconnect and CancelRequest methods.

One of the following circumstances occurred:
The link is not currently connected. The Connect method must be called before attempting to read from from the controller.
The Image Area is not supported by this controller. The image area is not supported by the RMC75S and RMC75P, and requires firmware 3.34.0 or newer.

The read failed due to a communication failure. Check that the remote device is powered up, check the communication wiring, and check the communication configuration of both the local and remote devices. Check the Message property of the exception for a description of the communication failure.
The caller does not have the required permission. -or- specified a file that is read-only.

The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
The specified path is invalid, (for example, it is on an unmapped drive).
An I/O error occurred while creating or writing to the file.
is in an invalid format.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.WriteImage(System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Writes the specified controller image to the controller and applies it to the controller. By default, the image will be saved to flash and the controller will be restarted. The controller image must be obtained using the ReadImage method. For saving and restoring the controller image using a file, use the ReadImageToFile and WriteImageFromFile methods. This method is only supported on the RMC75E and RMC150E controllers with firmware 3.34.0 or newer.
member.param: Flags used to control how the image is applied. Refer to the RMCTools documentation on the Image Area for a current list of options. Specify zero (0) to use default options.
An array of Integer values containing the controller image. The data must have been created using the ReadImage method.
member.exception: The parameter refers to a null (Nothing in Visual Basic) object.
The parameter is out of range.
This read was cancelled by a call on another thread to one of the Disconnect and CancelRequest methods.

One of the following circumstances occurred:
The link is not currently connected. The Connect method must be called before attempting to read from or write to the controller.
The Image Area is not supported by this controller. The image area is not supported by the RMC75S and RMC75P, and requires firmware 3.34.0 or newer.
The image is corrupt or not a recognized version.
The Do Not Restart Controller (+16) option was selected, but the image requires restarting the controller.
The Do Not Restart Controller (+16) option was selected but the controller is not in PROGRAM mode.
The image downloaded is intended for a different physical controller.

The write failed due to a communication failure. Check that the remote device is powered up, check the communication wiring, and check the communication configuration of both the local and remote devices. Check the Message property of the exception for a description of the communication failure.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.WriteImageFromFile(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Loads the controller image from the specified file, writes it to the controller, and applies it. By default, the image will be saved to flash and the controller will be restarted. The controller image file must have been created using the ReadImageToFile method. For saving and restoring the controller image using an array in memory instead of using a file, use the ReadImage and WriteImage methods. This method is only supported on the RMC75E and RMC150E controllers with firmware 3.34.0 or newer.
member.param: Flags used to control how the image is applied. Refer to the RMCTools documentation on the Image Area for a current list of options. Specify zero (0) to use default options.
The file name to load the controller image from. This image file should be created by the ReadImageToFile method.
member.exception: The parameter refers to a null (Nothing in Visual Basic) object.
The parameter is out of range, or the parameter is blank.
This write was cancelled by a call on another thread to one of the Disconnect and CancelRequest methods.

One of the following circumstances occurred:
The link is not currently connected. The Connect method must be called before attempting to read from or write to the controller.
The Image Area is not supported by this controller. The image area is not supported by the RMC75S and RMC75P, and requires firmware 3.34.0 or newer.
The image is corrupt or not a recognized version.
The Do Not Restart Controller (+16) option was selected, but the image requires restarting the controller.
The Do Not Restart Controller (+16) option was selected but the controller is not in PROGRAM mode.
The image downloaded is intended for a different physical controller.

The write failed due to a communication failure. Check that the remote device is powered up, check the communication wiring, and check the communication configuration of both the local and remote devices. Check the Message property of the exception for a description of the communication failure.

The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
The specified path is invalid, (for example, it is on an unmapped drive).
specified a directory -or- The caller does not have the required permission.
The file specified in was not found.
is in an invalid format.
The end of the stream was reached unexpectedly.
An I/O error occurred while reading from the file.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.Dispose
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the RMCLink object.

member.name: M:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.Finalize
member.summary: Releases unmanaged resources and performs other cleanup operations before the Component is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: T:RMCLinkNET.RMCLink.ConversionUnion
member.summary: This private structure is used by the FRegToLReg and LRegToFReg functions.

member.name: T:RMCLinkCOM.DeviceType
member.summary: Matches the COM control's expectations for the DeviceType enumeration values.

member.name: T:RMCLinkCOM.PingType
member.summary: Matches the COM control's expectations for the PingType enumeration values.

member.name: T:RMCLinkCOM.RMCLinkServerClass
member.summary: This class holds the CLSID of the RMCLinkServer object.
member.remarks: Notice that in C#, the class should be created as "new RMCLinkServer()" instead of "new RMCLinkServerClass()", which will require a cast to the interface.

member.name: T:RMCLinkCOM.RMCLinkServer
member.summary: This is the CoClass object for RMCLinkServer. Use it to create new instances using CoCreateInstance behind the scenes.

member.name: T:RMCLinkCOM.IRMCLinkServer
member.summary: This is the interface used by the RMCLinkServer object.

member.name: T:RMCLinkCOM.RMCLink
member.summary: This is the non-creatable RMCLink class. Instances of this type only come from IRMCLinkServer's methods.

member.name: T:RMCLinkCOM.IRMCLink
member.summary: This is the interface used by the RMCLink object.
